attributes.action: Give doctors the right to review driving licenses for people with epilepsy on a case by case basis
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
456,000 or one in every 131 people in the UK has epilepsy, with more people diagnosed each day!

Each time someone has an epileptic fit they have to wait a minimum of a year, some times two years to get their driving license back.

Fair enough, some people it will take that long to regain stability, others will be fine the next day but still have to wait a year to drive again.

This not only changes someone’s life in that they can no longer go out or they need to move home to continue a normal life. This can also seriously affect someone’s chances of normal career progression and singles people out to be the person “not to get the job” in a job interview.

I therefore ask for this petition to consider allowing doctors the right to choose, on a case by case basis, when a person with epilepsy can drive.

This will increase the chances of someone’s road to recovery and progression with a normal life.
